Note: This may not always be possible especially if fit-out designs are coming straight from the brand. We can require a designer’s risk extension in the Contractors All Risk if absolutely necessary. This would cover any resultant damage due to design defects.

 

Amendments required from General Terms file:

 

5. The Tenant at its own cost shall obtain the following insurance policies during the fit out works period in respect of the fit-out works at the Premises –if applicable- and shall provide evidence to the landlord confirming that the insurance has been obtained:

a. Contractors’ All Risk Insurance Policy with no less than the value of works being conducted plus 20% and up to a limit of QR 50,000,000 of any one occurrence and in the aggregate whichever is higher.

b. Third Party Liability insurance, up to a limit of QR 50,000,000 QR 5,000,000 of any one occurrence and in the aggregate including the Tenant’s liability and principal`s existing and surrounding property with no sub-limits to indemnify against loss of or damage to property or death or bodily injury of third parties as a result of the utilization of the Premises.

                (Page 4)

 

Note: Insuring in excess of the contract value does not provide any additional benefit, as the insurer will only cover damages related to the works or surrounding property. Also, requiring a QR 50M liability limit on a contractor’s policy is excessive and would substantially increase the premium.

 

Remaining terms are conditions relating to insurance are OK and can be accepted as is.

 

Best Regards,

Hagop
